meanings.definition: A rack or framework for holding hay.
meanings.sent1: The farmer stored the hay on the hayracks in the barn.
meanings.sent2: The hayracks in the field were sturdy and well-built.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to climb the hayracks for a better view.
meanings.sent4: The hayracks stood tall like guardians of the golden hay.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the hayracks painted a beautiful silhouette.

meanings.definition: To store or stack hay on a rack.
meanings.sent1: The workers hayracked the freshly cut hay to dry in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Farmers hayracks hay to keep it organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent3: I hayracked the hay in a neat pattern, making it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: She hayracks the hay with precision, ensuring no wastage.
meanings.sent5: The wind gently swayed the hayracked hay, creating a peaceful scene.

meanings.sent1: The farm had multiple hayracks to store different types of hay.
meanings.sent2: The hayracks in the field were painted in bright colors.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek around the hayracks, giggling.
meanings.sent4: The hayracks lined up in a row, resembling soldiers on duty.
meanings.sent5: The birds perched on the hayracks, chirping happily in the morning.
